qas.question: What duties did Edward Schnell have?

answers.text: military instructor and procurer of weapons

qas.question: Who did Edward Schnell work for?
What was Edward Schnell's Japanese name?

context: In the same war, the <a0_0>Prussian<a0_0/> Edward Schnell served <a2_0>the Aizu domain<a2_0/> as a <a1_0>military instructor and procurer of weapons<a1_0/>. He was granted the Japanese name <a3_0>Hiramatsu Buhei<a3_0/> (平松武兵衛), which inverted the characters of the daimyo's name Matsudaira. Hiramatsu (Schnell) was given the right to wear swords, as well as a residence in the castle town of <a4_0>Wakamatsu<a4_0/>, a Japanese wife, and retainers. In many contemporary references, he is portrayed wearing a Japanese kimono, overcoat, and swords, with Western riding trousers and boots.
